page.title: 06A LOCAL FARMER'S WORRIES.
page.content: Local hazards for the farmer are flukes,worms and red water ticks.These must be spotted and treated.Less easy to solve seems to be the problem of barren cows.Vets have no answer.Some farmers suspect overuse of sprays, fertilisers and slurry.Clean fields do not have the plants and herbs where perhaps the cattle obtained the trace elements they need.Farmers resent the fact that the customer pays about three times the amount that they receive for their milk.The quota system was ill conceived,causing a 9% cut in income.The Advisory Service advocates new ideas without local knowledge.Farmers fear the future because of the artificial nature of the market-how long can we go on producing stuff that nobody wants?
